ygData.subject: Re: Enchanters
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: LKW  Can rise fishing skill by merely fishing at pier?  How u know ya skill max out?  How can u make $ via fishing?  Do u
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: LKW <leekw13@...>
Can rise fishing skill by merely fishing at pier? How u know ya skill max
out? How can u make $ via fishing? Do u really catch fishes and sell?
>>A pole costs 20 silver. Each fish sold is 2 silver. That makes it that you
have to sell 10 fishes to get back your cost price. You will be losing money
within the first 25 skill pt range. After that, I made 1 plat an hour. Small
money but nice talking to all those elf babes <drools>

So far I cannot buy decent food/drink. I buy those grapes and wines and in
the
end dunno how to consume them ;(
>>Leave those grapes and wines alone. If I am right, you cannot drink from
bottle, with exception of milk. Stick to Muffins and Milk! Best Value for
money! Also, those muffins weight only 0.1 wt! Super light!

Now I just bought a old great stave. Better than my dagger. Can I max out
my 2H blunt skill by using the stave to hunt all time, w/o using up
practising point on it?
>>From the 1pt to 20pt range of gaining skill is always damn slow.
Senseheading for example, I can sit down and watch friends and keep tabbing
on it but only increase to <3>! After 20, it will go up steady! Now to
answer your question, YES.

When I rise a lvl, I use the points on some skills
but yet it remain awkful, why?
>>Put only 1 practise point in every new skill you acquire.

Now I use my skill points on those skills
with the coin symbols - chanelling and alteration, is it ok?
>>When a coin symbol appears, that means your skill is at 20 or above and
you have to pay to train.

Wilson aka Yutaka
